thread.section_title: NWAonline stories: High School Sports - Northwest Arkansas
thread.title: Prep roundup

title: Prep roundup
text:
Posted: October 23, 2015 at 1 a.m. 
JUNIOR HIGH FOOTBALL 
Bentonville Black 31, 
Siloam Springs 6 
Bentonville Black rode the momentum of a strong rushing attack to blast Siloam Springs on the road Thursday night. 
Harrison Campbell led the Tiger ground game with rushing touchdowns of 43 and 11 yards. Landon Beeler and Noah Fetherols also scored touchdowns for Black (6-2). 
In the eighth-grade game Lincoln beat Siloam 14-0. 
Springdale Southwest 30, 
Rogers Heritage 6 
Grant Allen connected with Miller Herndon for two touchdowns as Springdale Southwest defeated Rogers Heritage. 
The Cougars (5-3) also had key help from running back William Teal, who rushed for two touchdowns. 
Southwest won the eighth-grade game 30-0 over Lingle. 
Springdale Central 38, 
Rogers High 6 
Connor Sikes rushed for four touchdowns as Central remained unbeaten with a win over Rogers High at home Thursday. 
Blake Adams hooked up with Brock Pounders on an 11-yard touchdown pass, and Pedro Rodriguez chipped in a 35-yard field goal for Central (8-0). 
Braden Gentry rushed for a touchdown for Rogers (1-7). 
Fayetteville Purple 42, 
Springdale George 12 
Carston Johnson and Jacob Shaw scored two touchdowns each to lead Purple over George. 
Barrette Adams, Matthew Deeds and Ryan Moore added touchdowns for Purple (4-4). Jason Ortiz kicked a 37 yard field goal for Fayetteville. 
Fayetteville White 30, 
Springdale Lakeside 27 
Schylar Adair rushed for three touchdowns to led White over Lakeside. 
White quarterback Darius Bowers threw a touchdown pass to Traven Mahone for the only other White (5-2) score. 
SPORTS CALENDAR 
Basketball 
Blazers skills academy 
The Arkansas Blazers are now taking registration for upcoming Skills Academy for boys/girls grades K-12. Visit ArkansasBlazers.org then select programs then Skills Academy for registration and details. The first 50 girls to sign up will attend camp for free. Send additional inquires or questions to ArkansasBlazers@gmail.com. 
Lacrosse 
RAC program under way 
The Rogers Activity Center will offer fall 7v7 lacrosse for boys and girls in grades K to 12. The cost for the program is $100 plus a $20 RAC annual membership. The divisions offered will be K-4 coed, grades 5-8 girls, 5-6 boys, 7-8 boys, 9-12 girls and 9-12 boys. Players (boys) must provide their own shoes, lacrosse gloves, shoulder pads, arm pads, helmet, stick, chinstrap, and mouthpiece. Players (girls) must provide their own shoes, lacrosse goggles, stick and mouthpiece. The league will provide each player with a game jersey. For players who demonstrate a financial need, a limited amount of lacrosse equipment is available on a first-come, first-served basis. Practices are underway at Veterans Park fields 3 and 4 in Rogers. High school boys are from 6 to 8 p.m. Mondays and Wednesdays, and all other groups are from 6 to 8 p.m. Tuesdays and Thursdays. All players within each grade division will practice together to begin the season. Thereafter, teams will be formed with an effort to balance talent, skill, and ability. 
Running 
Fayetteville Race Series 
Fayetteville Parks and Recreation will offer the Fayetteville Race Series, which will consist of six different events that vary between running, cycling and multisport activities. Events still ahead for the remainder of 2015: Run for the Parks! â€” Nov. 22. More details about each race as well as sponsorship and volunteering information can be found at www.fayetteville-ar.gov/1894 or call the Parks and Recreation office at 444-3471 or 444-3463. 
Softball 
Fayetteville Fastpitch league 
Fayetteville Fastpitch League is holding tryouts for Spring 2016 travel teams at the FHS Lady Dawg Yard on Oct. 22 and 25. Teams will be 14U, 12U, 10U and 8U and be affiliated with the Perfect Timing training facility in the off-season. You only have to attend one tryout session to be considered for selection. For more information nwafastpitch@gmail.com or 790-8988. 
ITEMS FOR THE SPORTS CALENDAR CAN BE EMAILED TO SPORTS@NWADG.COM. THERE IS NO CHARGE FOR SPORTS CALENDAR ITEMS. 
(Advertisement)
